optProblem

Class StochasticOptProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • optProblem.StochasticOptProblem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptProblem

    public class StochasticOptProblem
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptProblem
    Class of the Optimization Problem. We have 4 kinds of attributes that are non static: time related, individual related, event related and map related.
    Since:
    2018-04-30
    Version:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • StochasticOptProblem

        public StochasticOptProblem()
        Constructor with no arguments for the Optimization Problem. All it does is create the empty lists that will be used.

      • StochasticOptProblem

        public StochasticOptProblem(int max_indss,
                            double max_timee,
                            int dmean,
                            int mmean,
                            int rmean,
                            int xx,
                            int yy,
                            int no,
                            int cmaxx,
                            int kk)
        More advanced constructor that actually has values to put in the variables. It invokes the no arg constructor so we dont have to write the same thing twice.
        Parameters:
        max_indss - is the maximum number of alive individuals.
        max_timee - is the total simulation time.
        dmean - is the value to use in the mean of the death events.
        mmean - is the value to use in the mean of the move events.
        rmean - is the value to use in the mean of the reproduction events.
        xx - is the number of columns of the map (possible X values will go from 1 to xx inclusive).
        yy - is the number of rows of the map (possible Y values will go from 1 to yy inclusive).
        no - is the number of obstacles in the map.
        cmaxx - is the maximum cost of a Special Zone.
        kk - is the comfort sensitivity parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • createFirstInds

        public void createFirstInds()
        Method to create the first set of individuals. Each call of this method creates one new individual at the start point. The Death event is added to the PEC and the Move and Reproduction are only added if they occur prior to the Death. Should only be called when the Optimization Problem object has been correctly initialized using the full constructor.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(int max_indss,
                       double max_timee,
                       int dmean,
                       int mmean,
                       int rmean,
                       Map parsedMap,
                       Point initialPoint,
                       Point finalPoint,
                       int kk,
                       int num_inds_init)
        Description copied from interface: OptProblem
        This method should work as a constructor for an optimization problem, setting up everything that is needed for the simulate and run methods.

        Most of the parameters are self explanatory since they are the ones in the project paper.

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface OptProblem
        Parameters:
        max_indss - is the maximum number of individuals in the
        max_timee - is the maximum simulation time
        dmean - is the constant to multiply when getting the death mean for the exponential
        mmean - is the constant to multiply when getting the move mean for the exponential
        rmean - is the constant to multiply when getting the reproduction mean for the exponential
        parsedMap - is the Map that we want to use in this optimization problem
        initialPoint - is the initial point where individuals should start
        finalPoint - is the final point that we want to achieve
        kk - is the comfort sensitivity
        num_inds_init - is the starting number of individuals

      • simulate

        public void simulate()
        Description copied from interface: OptProblem
        This method is responsible for running the simulation itself.
        Specified by:
        simulate in interface OptProblem

      • runOptimizationProblem

        public void runOptimizationProblem(java.lang.String filename)
        Description copied from interface: OptProblem
        This method is the whole problem in one. It should open the file specified in the arguments, parse it accordingly, initialize que optimization problem and then call the simulate method.
        Specified by:
        runOptimizationProblem in interface OptProblem
        Parameters:
        filename - is the name of the file containing the test
